channel.title: Renewable energy
channel.description:
If every town invested in 20 wind turbines. If every roof was covered in solar panels. If we packed all our garbage into a spaceship and sent it into the sun/to another planet?
Wouldn't it be a better world?
I would like to look into renewable energy more, but I cannot be bothered to scowl google.
What crazy ideas have you got that could make the world a better place?
For example: Legalising all drugs. [I sort of agree with this]

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

Go up in the sky, breathe in all the gas, and get high. Free drugs, and saving the environment.

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:12, topic:190651”]Those adverts make me laugh - a few years ago they said “washing at 60? step down to 40!”, now its “washing at 40? step down to 30!”.

What next, washing in liquid nitrogen?[/quote]
No, not wash your clothes.
You just go in the shower with your clothes on.

Read full topic

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:11, topic:190651”]Yeah i saw a few adverts saying about not washing your clothes at 40C.

I couldn’t care mucha bout that because I do not wash my own clothes.

R.I.P RSC do you know what the reason was for green peace being pissed at the wind turbine idea? I can’t see anything wrong with turbines exept from them being a bit ugly, but then again when I see them it reminds me to think about saving energy.[/quote]

I’m not sure if it was grean peace, but their argument was that it was horizon polution.

Read full topic

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:14, topic:190651”]They will probably start telling people they aren’t allowed to use a kettle.

“Are you making beverages at 100C? Step down to 50C and enjoy a better world, for a shittier cup of tea.”[/quote]

Judging by how shit our government is being at the mo i can actually see that happening

item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:

I see an advert that says switch to 30 from 40 or what ever, mind you the higher the temperature the stains go, the bugs go etc etc, nurses clothes are boiled to get the crap off…

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

We in Holland have quite a few wind turbines, but the environment groups always have to fuck it up. There was a plan for a big wind turbine park in the sea, but no, greanpeace or some other clan of fuckers didnt like it. Also, there is a commercial on tv that states that if everyone cleans there clothes at 30 C instead of 60 C 3 million people can power everything in their houses with the energy that is saved.

Read full topic

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:7, topic:190651”]I really do wonder though, if we some how could make really efficient solar panels very cheaply, how much energy would for instance the U.K. create in one day?

Or if every person changed every lightbulb to those “Energy efficient” ones.

Also I heard on the radio, i’m not sure it might have already gone, but there was a day Scheduled in the south east of england for everyone to turn off all un needed electrical equipment for a certain hour of the day. And they were going to measure how much energy we save. I don’t think its a very practical idea but just thought i’d also mention it.[/quote]

beat me to it, Not sure when it happened but I heard about it on 2CRFM or what ever, the spoke about it and I got out the car…

Read full topic

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I really do wonder though, if we some how could make really efficient solar panels very cheaply, how much energy would for instance the U.K. create in one day?

Or if every person changed every lightbulb to those “Energy efficient” ones.

Also I heard on the radio, i’m not sure it might have already gone, but there was a day Scheduled in the south east of england for everyone to turn off all un needed electrical equipment for a certain hour of the day. And they were going to measure how much energy we save. I don’t think its a very practical idea but just thought i’d also mention it.

Read full topic

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Ye, I have one of those energy efficient bulbs and they take ages to ‘warm’ up. So when I turn it on at night or something its still quite dark after 5 minutes, then it gets brighter. One of those balls with the LEDs all over it are really really energy efficient! Mythbusters accidentally proved it.

We are getting a few wind turbines near were I live, I just want to cover all the signs that say:
[center]NO
Wind
Turbines
Here
[/center]

I want to cover the part that says no and add a please or take them down. I asked my dad what he thinks, hes kinda pissed off that Holland, Denmark, (Places like that or near it) Tried this stuff 10 years ago, and it didn’t work. I want to move to California, as much as I hate the fucking stupid half-arsed americans, Arnold Schwarzenegger and his country of ‘green’ living makes me want to go there. The car my mums getting near the end of march wouldn’t be allowed in California, its not efficient enough.

Down in Cornwall they have wind turbines… When I say have I mean A LOT.

Read full topic

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

davidude36:

If we packed all our garbage into a spaceship and sent it into the sun/to another planet?

Not gonna work.

davidude36:

scowl google.

Mopman:

I’ve often wondered about those energy efficient bulbs - they look like they would take more energy to produce, to me, although I’m not 100% sure.

Play it safe. Get fluorescent or LED’s.

Read full topic

item.title: Renewable energy
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:190651”]Does the “if every town invested in 20 wind turbines…” include the energy used in producing the turbines, out of curiosity?

I’ve often wondered about those energy efficient bulbs - they look like they would take more energy to produce, to me, although I’m not 100% sure. It’s kinda like when hippies burn candles and claim to be helping the environment :D[/quote]
If you use clean energy to make them it would be good, but who will pay for all the turbines?

Read full topic
